FuncDef:
The optical-tx-power target command configures an optical power for an optical module.
The undo optical-tx-power command restores the default at optical power of an optical module.
By default, the optical power of an optical module is -5.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an optical power.
The value is an integer ranging from -180 to 10, in 0.1 dB.
For CR5D00D8NC70s, CR5D00D4NC70s, CR5D00E4NC7Ps, and CR5D00E8NC7Ps, the value is an integer ranging from -150 to 10, in 0.1 dB. (The model of the optical module is OSNB00C02, 118Gbps(4*25.78/4*27.95)-CFP2-SMF-192.1-196.05THz-1200km-commercial.)

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set an attenuation value of the output power on an optical interface, run the optical-tx-power command. A higher attenuation value will damage the optical module laser on the peer end, whereas a lower attenuation value will cause link connection failures.
Precautions
The CR5D00D2NT70 (2-Port 100GE Tunable DWDM Integrated Line Processing Unit (LPUI-200)) supports this command.
The following interface boards and subcards do not support this command:
CR5D00T6XF70: 6-Port OTU2-SFP+ Flexible Card(P120)CR5D00TBXF70: 12-Port OTU2-SFP+ Flexible Card(P240)CR5D00TBXF71: 12-Port OTU2-SFP+ Integrated Line Processing Unit (LPUI-120)CR5D00TFXF71: 24-Port OTU2-SFP+ Integrated Line Processing Unit (LPUI-240)CR5D00D8NC70: 8-Port 100G ETH/DWDM-CFP2 Integrated Line Processing Unit(LPUI-1T)CR5D00E8NC7P: 8-Port 100G ETH/DWDM-CFP2 Integrated Line Processing Unit CM(LPUI-1T-CM)CR5D00E4NC7P: 4-Port 100G ETH/DWDM-CFP2 Integrated Line Processing Unit CM(LPUI-480-CM)CR5D00D4NC70: 4-Port 100G ETH/DWDM-CFP2 Integrated Line Processing Unit(LPUI-480)
If the optical-tx-power command is configured on an interface with a 100 Gbit/s CFP2 DWDM optical module inserted, the optical power configuration takes a maximum of 10s to take effect. To check whether the configuration takes effect, run the display this interface command. (The model of the optical module is OSNB00C02, 118Gbps(4*25.78/4*27.95)-CFP2-SMF-192.1-196.05THz-1200km-commercial.)
